newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela recognises Air France, KLM forex losses.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela recognises Air France, KLM forex losses.

text.p: Venezuela said Wednesday it would pay Dutch airline KLM and Air France exchange losses incurred by the two companies under 1995-6 Venezuelan exchange controls.
Finance Minister Luis Raul Matos Azocar told reporters: "This is proof that Venezuela is a country that respects international accords".
Matos did not reveal the amount, but KLM said early last year the losses totaled some $8 million. Air France figures were not available.

Matos said the payments would be made under accords signed with both countries before the exchange controls were put in place in June 1994. The agreements shielded the airlines against exchange losses.
